720517f-a.text:
Nudson Street, south from Spring Street, a view taken in connection with the digging of the Holland Vehicular Tunnel under Spring Street. The work began the previous October; and the tunnel will be opened in 1927, around Thanksgiving. Nos. 298, 226, 294-292 Hudson Street, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of Spring Street, under which the westbound tube of the tunnel curves, have been demolished. No 294-292 was the Duane Methodist Eppiscopal Church, established 1797, which moved up here after the burning of the original church in Duane Street, in 1861. Not long after 192S this church will settle down in the old house at 57d Broome Street on the Holland Tunnel Plaza, two doors away from Our Lady of Vilna
September, 1923.
720517f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Spring Street, Manhattan, NY

720518f-a.text:
Hudson Street, at and south from the S.W. corner of Spring Street, a view talen in connection with the digging of the Holland
Vehicular Tunnel uncer Spring Street.
Notice the poster of Loew's Sheridan Theatre, at the right. This picture was taken just after the Dempsey-Firpo heavyweight fight.
Late September, 1923.
720518f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Spring Street, Manhattan, NY

723380f-a.text:
294 Spring Street, a side view of 291 Hudson Street, at the S.W. corner, a view taken a day or two after the view of Hudson Street at and south from this corner. Water mains are being brought up out of harm's way while the westbound tube of the Hclland Vehicular
Tunnel is dug under Spring Street.
Late September, 1923.
723380f-a.folder: Spring Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

723381f-a.text:
296-298-300 Spring Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of Hudson Street. Tunncl digging is going on under Spring Street, and the water main has just been brought out into the open. The first of these houses is a little two-story frame building, with only a facing of brick. It and No. 298, the middle one, will be torn down in three or four years and replaced by a onestory brick store.
Late September, 1923.
723381f-a.folder: Spring Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

723382f-a.text:
Spring Street, west from No. 298, south side, west of Hudson Street.
Early September, 1923.
View No. 1.
723382f-a.folder: Spring Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

723384f-a.text:
Spring Streot, west from No. 300, south side, and 301, north side, west of Hudson Street. See the view west from and including Hudson Street, taken within a day or two of this one. This gives a good view of 302, 304, 3Oo Spring Street, the frame houses on the south side, adjoining and at the east corner of Renwick Street.
Early Auguat, 1923.
723384f-a.folder: Spring Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

723387f-a.text:
Spring Street, at and west from the S.W. corner of Hudson Street, during the early stages of the digging of the Holland Vehicular Tunnel, the work on which began the previous October.
Mid-September, 1923.
723387f-a.folder: Spring Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

723388f-a.text:
Spring Street, west from and including Hudson Street, during the early atages of excavating for the westbound tube of the Holland Vehicular Tunnel, work on which began the previous October. Now
they ane getting ready to take up the water mmins.
On the south side, notice the old houses between Hudson and Renwick Streets. No. 298, adjoining the Hudson Street corner, and Nos. 3002-306, adjoining and at the Renwick Street corner are frame
houses faced with brick.
on the Cornell M Underhill warehouse at 311 Spring Street, on the nnorth side, notice the flag at half mast. This picture must have been taken just after the death of Presicent Ha ding.
Early AuAust, 1923.

Spring Street, west from anc incluoing Hudson Street, about halfway through the digging of the Holland Vehicular Tunnel, the west
bound branch of which is under Spring Street.

720512f-a.text:
(1)
Iudson Street, west side, south from, but not including Spring, to and including Canal Streets. The three 3-story buildings shon in the foreground, (Nos. 261-265), are frame structures, with brick fronts.
July 27, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a further view southward, on Hudson Street. The building shown on the extreme left, is 250 Hudson Stroet, at the N.E. corner of Broome, and it adjoins the entrance to the Hudson Tubes on the
Broome Street side.
July 27, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
